  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Safety / Environmental Compliance Manager",
  "description": "Jamub Group is a conglomerate of different companies duly registered in line with relevant laws of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, the attribute of which makes us a non-cyclical organisation. Established to deliver solutions in the various areas of our business interests, our delivery model spans Business to Business (B2B), Business to Government (B2G) and Business to Consumer (B2C) in the economic value chain with a range of products and services which cut across the industries.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Safety / Environmental Compliance Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Benue

Job Summary


	The Safety / Environmental Compliance Manager is responsible for developing, implementing, and enforcing the project&rsquo;s Health, Safety, and Environmental (HSE) plans.
	The role ensures full compliance with safety regulations, environmental requirements, and project standards by proactively identifying hazards, monitoring site conditions, managing safety certifications, and preventing incidents.
	The position also provides support as a Work Zone Traffic Control (WZTC) Officer during construction activities.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop, implement, and enforce the project Safety and Environmental Management Plans.
	Ensure compliance with all applicable safety, environmental, and regulatory requirements.
	Monitor site activities to identify danger zones, unsafe conditions, and environmental risks.
	Ensure corrective actions are implemented promptly to eliminate hazards.
	Conduct regular safety inspections and risk assessments across all work areas.
	Identify and control hazards related to construction activities, equipment operation, and traffic interfaces.
	Ensure hazardous materials are properly handled, stored, and disposed of in accordance with regulations.
	Monitor environmental aspects such as waste management, spill prevention, and site cleanliness.
	Assess construction equipment, tools, and machinery for defects or damage that could lead to injuries.
	Ensure defective or unsafe equipment is removed from service immediately.
	Manage all safety certifications, permits, and approvals required for the project.
	Verify that workers and operators hold valid safety training and certifications.
	Assist as a Work Zone Traffic Control Officer to ensure safe movement of vehicles and personnel.
	Support implementation of traffic management plans during construction activities.
	Coordinate with site teams to minimize risks to workers and road users.
	Organize and conduct safety inductions, toolbox talks, and safety training sessions.
	Promote safety awareness and environmental responsibility among all site personnel.
	Enforce the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) on site.
	Investigate accidents, near misses, and unsafe acts.
	Prepare incident reports and recommend preventive measures.
	Maintain accurate HSE records, inspection reports, and compliance documentation.
	Report safety performance and issues to project management.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree or Diploma in Engineering, Environmental Science, Occupational Health &amp; Safety, or related discipline.
	Minimum of 10&ndash;15 years of experience in safety and environmental management on construction or highway projects.
	Professional HSE certifications (e.g., NEBOSH, ISPON, OSHA, or equivalent) are an advantage.
	Proven experience managing HSE programs on active construction sites.
	Strong knowledge of construction safety and environmental regulations.
	Excellent hazard identification and risk management skills.
	Strong leadership and enforcement capability.
	Good communication and training skills.
	Ability to work effectively in high-risk construction environments.
	Strong documentation and reporting skills.


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and cover letter to:&nbsp;jobs@jamubgroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

	Ensure defective or unsafe equipment is removed from service immediately.
	Manage all safety certifications, permits, and approvals required for the project.
	Verify that workers and operators hold valid safety training and certifications.
	Assist as a Work Zone Traffic Control Officer to ensure safe movement of vehicles and personnel.
	Support implementation of traffic management plans during construction activities.
	Coordinate with site teams to minimize risks to workers and road users.
	Organize and conduct safety inductions, toolbox talks, and safety training sessions.
	Promote safety awareness and environmental responsibility among all site personnel.
	Enforce the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) on site.
	Investigate accidents, near misses, and unsafe acts.
	Prepare incident reports and recommend preventive measures.
	Maintain accurate HSE records, inspection reports, and compliance documentation.
	Report safety performance and issues to project management.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree or Diploma in Engineering, Environmental Science, Occupational Health & Safety, or related discipline.
	Minimum of 10–15 years of experience in safety and environmental management on construction or highway projects.
	Professional HSE certifications (e.g., NEBOSH, ISPON, OSHA, or equivalent) are an advantage.
	Proven experience managing HSE programs on active construction sites.
	Strong knowledge of construction safety and environmental regulations.
	Excellent hazard identification and risk management skills.
	Strong leadership and enforcement capability.
	Good communication and training skills.
	Ability to work effectively in high-risk construction environments.
	Strong documentation and reporting skills.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs and cover letter to: jobs@jamubgroup.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
